adrFormatAddress: 55 Grove St, New York, NY 10014, USA

originalText.text: We looked around the city for a small venue for our wedding and once we saw Little Owl the Townhouse we knew it was the place for us. They coordinated everything for us, right down to the cake. Flowers, DJ, photographer, everything is arranged. Amanda, the event planner they provided, is not only incredibly detailed, organized and on top of everything, but a wonderful person and we loved working with her. The day of the wedding, my niece was to perform a song for us and on the way to the venue her guitar was left in the trunk of the cab. Miraculously, the staff was able to produce a guitar for her within a 1/2 an hour. The food was wonderful and the wine and cocktails were paired well with what was served. The flowers and decor were  magical! The wedding went off without a hitch, all due to the detailed planning by Amanda, the diligence of the staff and our day of coordinator, Alexandra. There's not one thing we would say could have been better. It was perfect in every way.

originalText.text: We designed a tropical corporate event for Jet Blue last year, just before the pandemic. The space, located in Manhattan,  is cozy and consist of 2 floors. The top is bigger than the bottom where you can find a kitchen and a bar. The venue is perfect for some gatherings

originalText.text: My photos DON'T do this gorgeous space justice. By all means, check out the website and their Instagram account. Such a customizable event space - from family affairs to corporate gatherings. Use all three floors or two or just one. Staff so warm, professional, knowledgeable and accommodating. A West Village gem.

text.text: My photos DON'T do this gorgeous space justice. By all means, check out the website and their Instagram account. A West Village gem.

originalText.text: I was attending a friend's wedding shower and my heel broke. The managers of the event saw this happen, asked for my shoe size, and 5 minutes later came out with rescue flats for me. I never would have expected them to bring me new shoes to walk in, but between this and the EXCEPTIONAL service I'd give them 12 stars if I could.

text.text: I was attending a friend's wedding shower and my heel broke. The managers of the event saw this happen, asked for my shoe size, and 5 minutes later came out with rescue flats for me. I never would have expected them to bring me new shoes to walk in, but between this and the EXCEPTIONAL service I'd give them 12 stars if I could.

originalText.text: REALLY WELL DONE. Last night we were guests at a dinner for about 40. Cocktails were served both on the main floor of the townhouse and on the lower level (basement) which was quite pleasant. Then dinner up two flights. We joked that it was like being at dinner in Amsterdam. The table was long and we were able to talk with about 8 people with whom we were sitting (sort of like being at a table for 8). Staff was terrific. Food was terrific. Of course, this was a 25th birthday celebration and we were the old guys. For a private party, consider it.
